In ''Vouchers That Win'' (Op-Ed, Oct. 11), Felicia Wong describes plans that overcome some objections to voucher systems, but not another important one. Vouchers will be a seemingly innocent first step in knocking down the wall between church and state.

Many secular private schools will not accept vouchers for a variety of reasons, including the fact that vouchers will not cover the full cost. Religious schools, with other sources of financing, will be in a better position to underwrite the additional costs of voucher students. So vouchers will end up channeling students to religious schools.
MARC L. KUTNER Austin, Tex., Oct. 11, 2000
